Basic details: Mary Johnson, a 63-year-old woman, comes back to the clinic for follow-up of her diabetes management.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sitting comfortably in the examination room, appears well-nourished.
Shows a slight tremor in her hands.
Occasionally glances at her glucose meter, which is on the table next to her.
If asked about her diabetes, she responds with a smile but seems anxious about her blood sugar levels.
Challenging question: "Am I doing enough to manage my diabetes? What if my blood sugar levels are still high?"
